page.title: 09Religion, Yelden
page.content: The wesleyan Chapel was built in 1884, the architect, John Blunt belonged to the Higham Ferrars circuit. There are 2 ministers at present. the Chapel holds regular services on the first Sunday of every month at 11am. Members meet at about 10.45am for coffee before the service. On average there are about 5 members present, however only 2 of these actually live in Yelden. There are extra afternoon services to celebrate Easter, the Chapel Anniversary, Harvest Festival and Christmas. The Chapel Steward is a regular visitor to homes in the village delivering magazines, flowers and gifts to the elderly and ill, collecting for the Overseas Mission Fund and for the National Childrens Home.
